title: Strengthening Programming Practical Competencies: Language Learning Based on Mathematical Concepts Using an Ethnographic Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Students can accurately explain over 50 mathematical terms in the target language.
Students create a portfolio that linguistically expresses mathematical problem-solving processes using digital tools.

Over a 6-month course, learners analyze language usage patterns (15 hours of observational data) in three peer learners' software development projects (code reviews, documentation, meeting minutes, etc.), propose at least five improvement plans based on findings, and submit a final report incorporating peer feedback (average score ≥4.0 on a 5-point scale).

Learners analyze participatory observation data (including feedback from at least 10 users) to develop a human-factor-integrated learning tool prototype (e.g., Figma/Adobe XD design or low-code solution) within 6 months, achieving an average usability test score ≥4.0 (5-point scale) from ≥5 testers.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
